The ACs and MC used in our experiments were sampled from our Field Experiment Station (Hobq Desert, 40°21′N, 109°51′E). As a transitional zone of plateau desert and desert steppe, the region is a typical continental monsoon climate with an average elevation of 1040 m and an annual mean temperature of 6.1 °C (the lowest is −34.5 °C and the highest is 40.2 °C). The annual precipitation and potential evapotranspiration respectively is 293 mm and 2400 mm. The average wind velocity is 3.3 m s −1 and windy (>5 m s −1) day is more than 180 d y −1. The soil texture is aeolian sandy soil, and large areas are shifting sand dunes with an average relative height of 5 m. At present, there is an artificial vegetation area of nearly 5000 m 2 formed by cyanobacterial inoculation, in which there are abundant biocrusts
